page.title: 02POPULATION
page.content: This area is dominated by{arable land. The population is randomly distributed throughout the region and resides in {farmhouses and small cottages.}There are no settlements of any significant size and the population travels to Ellon for everyday services and requirements. The farms have remained in family ownership over many generations so the population has seen few changes until the early 1970's when there was an influx of{oil {related personel.}The landscape portrays an image of profitable agricultural activities, shown by well maintained farmhouses and buildings, the size of fields and the level of mechanisation found on the farms. The region is likely to remain predominantly agricultural as{oil {reserves}are only predicted to last until the 1990's.
